item.title: New Podcast
item.itunes:author: Martin K. Schröder
item.itunes:subtitle: Swedish Embedded Group: New Podcast
item.itunes:summary: Episode 7 - We talk about the current wave of new hardware bought about by Google, Microsoft and Apple.
item.description: Episode 7 - We talk about the current wave of new hardware bought about by Google, Microsoft and Apple. Microsoft and Google have famously been all about software, but that's changed significantly over the last few years. Microsoft and now Google have graduated to making their own hardware. Both companies traditionally licensed (or gave away) their software to run on devices made by other manufacturers. So why the move from software to hardware? BONUS: We geek out for another 20 minutes at the end of the episode discussing the new hardware releases. It's a bit of a response to some of the discussion we had back in episode 1. Show Notes Available at https://swedishembedded.com/2021/episode-1.html.

item.title: Is hardware the new software?
item.itunes:author: Martin K. Schröder
item.itunes:subtitle: Swedish Embedded Group: Is hardware the new software?
item.itunes:summary: Episode 7 - We talk about the current wave of new hardware bought about by Google, Microsoft and Apple.
item.description: Episode 7 - We talk about the current wave of new hardware bought about by Google, Microsoft and Apple. Microsoft and Google have famously been all about software, but that's changed significantly over the last few years. Microsoft and now Google have graduated to making their own hardware. Both companies traditionally licensed (or gave away) their software to run on devices made by other manufacturers. So why the move from software to hardware? BONUS: We geek out for another 20 minutes at the end of the episode discussing the new hardware releases. It's a bit of a response to some of the discussion we had back in episode 1. Show Notes Available at https://swedishembedded.com/2016/episode-7.html.

item.title: Can someone explain drones to me?
item.itunes:author: Martin K. Schröder
item.itunes:subtitle: Swedish Embedded Group: Can someone explain drones to me?
item.itunes:summary: Episode 6 - We talk drones and ask are they toys or something more sinister?
item.description: Episode 6 - We talk drones and ask are they toys or something more sinister? Drones seem to be the big thing at the moment but with a battery life of about 20 minutes usage is pretty short. So why are they touted as the next big thing? Show Notes Available at https://swedishembedded.com/2016/episode-6.html.

item.title: Learning for Free
item.itunes:author: Martin K. Schröder
item.itunes:subtitle: Swedish Embedded Group: Learning for Free
item.itunes:summary: Episode 5 - We discuss the potential of the web to Learn for free
item.description: Episode 5 - We discuss the potential of the web to Learn for free The internet is an amazing resource of free and available content - so how can we utilise that to learn? Show Notes Available at https://swedishembedded.com/2016/episode-5.html.
item.itunes:keywords: tools, web, stack overflow, cloud, labour, uber, facebook,

item.title: Hiding Behind Technology
item.itunes:author: Martin K. Schröder
item.itunes:subtitle: Swedish Embedded Group: Hiding Behind Technology
item.itunes:summary: Episode 4 - We discuss what does digital technology hide?
item.description: Episode 4 - We discuss what does digital technology hide? Digital technology represents an abstraction from the real world. It technical and programatic nature allow it to hide and conceal what's really happening in our world. Show Notes Available at https://swedishembedded.com/2016/episode-4.html.
item.itunes:keywords: technology, VR, refugees, cloud, labour, uber, facebook,

item.title: Will Netflix kill TV?
item.itunes:author: Martin K. Schröder
item.itunes:subtitle: Swedish Embedded Group: Will Netflix kill TV?
item.itunes:summary: Episode 3 - We ask the question - will Netflix kill TV?
item.description: Episode 3 - We ask the question - will Netflix kill TV? The power of TV has been dwindling over recent years. So will the experience of Netflix kill off TV? Show Notes Available at https://swedishembedded.com/2016/episode-3.html.

item.title: The Physicality of Stuff
item.itunes:author: Martin K. Schröder
item.itunes:subtitle: Swedish Embedded Group: The Physicality of Stuff
item.itunes:summary: Episode 2 - We asking what happens when physical stuff is replaced by the digital.
item.description: Episode 2 - We asking what happens when physical stuff is replaced by the digital. More and more of our lives are becoming digitised - digital objects without a physical equivalent or presence. What kind of effect does this have on us - our identity and how we navigate our history? Show Notes Available at https://swedishembedded.com/2016/episode-2.html.
item.itunes:keywords: Stuff, Physical Objects, DVDs, Photos, Identity

item.title: Boring iPhones & Digital Death
item.itunes:author: Martin K. Schröder
item.itunes:subtitle: Swedish Embedded Group: Boring iPhones & Digital Death
item.itunes:summary: Our first episode and we tackle just how boring new technology is and what death looks like in the digital age.
item.description: Our first episode and we tackle just how boring new technology is and what death looks like in the digital age. Join Tim, Ben and Adam for this, the first episode, as we discuss some of the things passing us by at the intersection of life and technology. Show Notes Available at https://swedishembedded.com/2016/episode-1.html.
